title: (x) 1960s poster casual script - hand lettered {Stephen}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116152927im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fontID3.jpg)

greetings, i was wondering if anyone knew of a font similar to the look from this 1960s poster font; it’s casual, handwriten-looking, with some flair and fun.

i’ve been looking for hours on font ID sites, and haven’t really found any font sets that match, but i remember seeing some a few months ago, any help, tips, advice, appreciated

big thanks  
dem

 [‹ (x) The Apex Theory logo - Solstice {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116152927/http:/typophile.com/node/18661 "Go to previous forum topic") [wide square techno sans used on www.familytreecounseling.com ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116152927/http:/typophile.com/node/18631 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dem

comments.content: Definitely not a font. Handwritten. Have a look at [Okay](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116152927/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=UR.109957.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Rockin%E2%80%99+Blues&sampleSize=48), [Polka](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116152927/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=SG.102075.0.0), [Flash](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116152927/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=UR.109837.0.0), [Brody](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116152927/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=UR.109735.0.0), and House Industries’ [scripts](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116152927/http:/houseind.com/index.php?page=fontsbystyle&s=9), especially the [Sign Painter](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116152927/http:/houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=23&subpage=viewfonts) kit.
thanks Stephen, House Casual will work perfectly, really appreicate the head ups, thanks again, dem
what is up with those colors? I see that blue/brown combination everywhere!

I think the blue/brown combo is coming back in style. My sister is getting married this summer, and she’s registering for a bunch of items in that color scheme. I think it’s cool, even though in a few years it may look kind of dated (again.)

But hey, all my mom’s wedding stuff is avocado green and harvest gold with Strawberries on it. You can so tell she got married in 1975. :)
